item.description:
Have dinner and then watch the full moon rise over the ocean as we hike along the beach!

There are about 2 hours between sunset and moonrise tonight. This will allow the eastern horizon to become sufficiently dark to experience an enormous full moon appearing to rise from the depths of the ocean. With a clear enough sky, it should be a magnificent sight!

We'll meet at 5:30 pm at Petey's for dinner/drinks and then do an easy hike along the coast for an hour or two.

Bring a headlamp/ flashlight. If there's snow or ice, we'll probably need microspikes rather than snowshoes. And who knows, if we have a few drinks we may even howl at the moon...

Crow Moon - The more northern tribes called this the Crow Moon, when the cawing of crows signals the end of winter. It's also called Worm Moon, when the ground softens and the earthworm casts reappear, inviting the return of the robins, or the Crust Moon because the snow cover becomes crusted from thawing by day and freezing at night, or the Sap Moon, marking the time to tap maple trees. Moonrise ~7:40pm.

Liability Release

AS A CONDITION OF ATTENDING THIS MEETUP, YOU AGREE TO hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer and his heirs, and all members and participants of the Seacoast Outdoors Meetup group from any and all claims for injury, illness, death, and/or property damage including those caused by negligence, ignorance, inexperience and other reasons. You also agree to assume all mental, physical, financial, and/or other risk associated with this meetup. Kayaking, camping, hiking, bicycling, snow sports, alcohol consumption, and other activities pose inherent risks and dangers. Participation in these activities is voluntary and dependent upon your own personal judgment.

Time and location are subject to change due to weather and other factors.  Always check email & this listing for updates before leaving home.
item.name: Mad March Moon Walk!
